title: Storytelling & Speaking: From Nerves to Narrative
description:
Learn to captivate any audience—from conference stages to boardrooms—through this comprehensive course on storytelling and public speaking. Starting with overcoming the fear that stops most people from ever taking the stage, you'll progress through mastering narrative techniques used by world champions, and ultimately develop the executive presence that moves rooms and changes minds.

In the Beginner level, you'll learn from experts who specialize in transforming fear into confidence. Matthew Dicks, holder of the world record for Moth StorySLAM wins (56), teaches you his famous "Homework for Life" technique for finding stories in everyday moments. Carmine Gallo, author of the bestselling "Talk Like TED," reveals the neuroscience behind presentations that stick. Alyson Connolly and Lee Glickstein provide proven techniques for managing anxiety and building authentic presence. These foundational episodes prove that everyone has stories worth telling and that fear is conquerable.

The Intermediate level brings you into the room with the world's top presentation and storytelling experts. Nancy Duarte, whose firm has created over 250,000 presentations for Apple, Google, and TED, teaches her "sparkline" method for persuasive business communication. Margot Leitman, who achieved a perfect 10 score at The Moth, reveals the techniques behind championship storytelling. Patricia Fripp, executive speech coach for over 40 years, shows you how to find and tell stories that inspire organizational change. These episodes transform good speakers into masterful communicators.

At the Advanced level, you'll learn from world champions and thought leaders operating at the absolute pinnacle of the craft. Bo Seo, winner of both the World Schools and World Universities Debating Championships and Harvard debate coach, teaches championship-level argumentation. Chris Anderson, TED curator for over 20 years, shares insights from coaching thousands of the world's most impactful speakers. You'll study classical rhetoric with university professors, learn from a Toastmasters World Champion, and master executive vocal presence.

What makes this course authoritative is the caliber of expertise: world champions (Moth, debate, Toastmasters), bestselling authors (Storyworthy, Talk Like TED, Resonate), institutional leaders (TED curator, Harvard coach, university professors), and executive coaches trusted by Fortune 500 companies. Whether you're preparing for your first presentation or refining skills that already land you keynote opportunities, this course provides the expert-backed, proven techniques you need to speak and tell stories powerfully.
